input.body:
The Multi-Source Data Analytics and
Triangulation (MSDAT) Platform Update

Saving lives through digital health data

Hi [subscriber],

I trust this meets you well. We hope this message finds you well! As part of our commitment to keeping you updated, here’s a summary of the enhancements, data updates, and developments on the MSDAT platform in 2024.

This MSDAT platform was set up by the Federal Ministry of Health (FMoH) through a collaboration with eHealth4everyone. It provides a single, transparent view of key health indicators from multiple data sources.

The platform also allows the comparison of key metrics across three categories of data sources, namely; routine, surveys, and global estimates.

Dashboards Update

A Recap of 2024 Updates on MSDAT

MSDAT Data Updates

  1. NDHS 2023 Updated on MSDAT

    2. The National Demographic and Health Survey (NDHS) 2023 data has been updated on MSDAT. A total of 82 indicators, including 40 new ones, have been integrated into the Health Outcomes & Service Coverage and Demographics dashboard.

    New indicators include:

    • Percentage of births occurring in a health facility
    • One dose of pneumococcal vaccine (PCV)
    • General Fertility Rate
    • Percentage of women taking iron supplements during pregnancy
    • Percentage of children fully vaccinated with basic antigens
    • Percentage of women who report specific ways to avoid getting malaria
    Img 5: screenshot showing “Percentage of young women with knowledge of HIV prevention methods” NDHS 2023 data

  2. NHWCP 2022 Data

    3. In February 2024, the team received the National Health Workforce Profile (NHWCP) 2022. The data was extracted and pushed to the Health Workforce dashboard on MSDAT, covering 109 indicators, including:

    • Density of medical doctors
    • Density of dental therapists in good standing (Licensed)
    • Number of dental surgery schools
    • Number of entrants into dental technology programmes
    • Number of graduates of dental technology programme
    Img 1; Health workforce dashboard showing Density of Medical doctors NHWCP 2022 data

  3. GRID3 Population Data!

    4. Geo-Referenced Infrastructure Demographic Data for Development(GRID) population and location data have been integrated into the Demographics Dashboard on MSDAT! You can now access National, State, and LGA total population figures, providing valuable insights for data-driven decision-making.

    Access the Gird3 data on the Demographics dashboard

    Img 2; Demographics dashboard showing Total Population Grid3 data

  4. IHME 2020 & 2021 data added to the Health Outcomes and Service Coverage and Demographics Dashboards!

    5. Data from the Institute of Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) 2020 and 2021 reports were added to MSDAT Health Outcomes and Service Coverage and Demographics Dashboards. Over a 100 indicators from both years report were added to the dashboards some of which includes:

    • Skilled Attendance at delivery birth
    • Adolescent Fertility rate
    • Total Fertility rate
    • Prevalence of children with diarrhoea
    • Total Population
    • Maternal mortality rate
    • Neonatal mortality rate (per 1000 live births)
    • Infant Mortality rate (per 1000)

    Access the IHME indicators on the Health Outcomes and Service Coverage & Demographics dashboards


    Img 3: screenshot showing infant mortality rate IHME 2021 data on Demographics Dashboard

  5. WHO-GHO & World Bank 2022-2023 Data Now Available on MSDAT

    6. A total of 15 indicators from WHO-Global Health Observatory (WHO-GHO) 2022 and 20 indicators from World Bank 2022 have been updated on the Health Outcomes and Demographics dashboards. Additionally, 8 new indicators from WHO-GHO 2023 and World Bank 2023 have been added, further enhancing the data available on MSDAT. These indicators include:

    • BCG Coverage
    • DPT 3/Penta 3 coverage
    • Infant Mortality rate
    • Measles Immunization Coverage
    • Neonatal mortality rate (per 1000 live births)
    • Percentage of households using open defecation
    • Percentage of households with a basic hand washing facility (soap and water)
    • Prevalence of HIV
    • Skilled attendance at delivery or birth
    • Under 5 Mortality rate
    • Population growth rate
    • Dependency ratio
    Img 4: DPT3/Penta3 Coverage WHO-GHO 2023 data


Enhancements to the Dashboards

  1. Integration of Advanced Analytics Dashboard

    2. In February 2024, the team successfully included the advanced analytics dashboard on the MSDAT platform. This dashboard contains 6 sections which include correlation analysis, predictive analysis, indicator comparison, multi-source comparison, bubble chart and descriptive analysis. The advanced analytics dashboard is built to allow users to analyse key health indicators through the power of predictive modelling to anticipate future health trends. Each of the sections of the Advanced analytics can easily be accessed from the “ select dashboards” dropdown. This can also be accessed via this link:

    Img 6: screenshot showing correlation analysis section of the dashboard

  2. Health Service Uptake (NHMIS- Quarterly) Dashboard

    3. A Quarterly version of the monthly Health Service Uptake dashboard was developed and integrated into the MSDAT. The Quarterly Health Service Uptake Dashboard offers a higher-level perspective on health service utilization. This new dashboard is designed to provide users of MSDAT with aggregated, quarter-by-quarter NHMIS-DHIS 2 data trends, enabling a broader understanding of service uptake patterns over time. Access the HSU Quarterly dashboard here!

    Img 7: screenshot of the HSU NHMIS- Quarterly dashboard

  3. Quarterly Performance Assessment Scorecard

    4. The Quarterly Performance Assessment Scorecard analyzes numerator data from the NHMIS on a quarterly basis and compares it to MICS(Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey) and NDHS(Nigeria Demographic and Health Survey). The scorecard shows %change from Quarter to Quarter and comparison trend analysis of data from previous year and the current year. This was developed to support the SWAP Ministerial team’s quarterly performance report. You can access the Scorecard dashboard here!

    Img 8: screenshot of the Quarterly Performance Assessment scorecard


Introducing New Features

  1. Indicators grouped into collapsible Program Areas

    2. Indicators on MSDAT are now properly grouped under respective program areas in a collapsible format. Users can now click on each program area to view all the indicators under it.



  2. Ability to Select Zones from the Location dropdown

    3. Users of MDSAT can now select zones from the location drop down across all subdashboards. This allows you to easily select and view subnational level data to support health status reports and decision making at the geopolitical zonal level.

  3. Regrouping of MSDAT Subdashboards!

    4. To allow easy access to any of the MSDAT subdashboards, they are now regrouped under Health Outcomes, Health Input, Health Outputs, Advanced Analytics, Population, Thematic Dashboard and Other Dashboards accordingly. This can be seen when users click on the “Select Dashboard” at the Menu section and the “About” page of MSDAT.



    What's Next?

    • • Data and metadata updates across sub-dashboards
    • • Integration of NHFS 2023 data to the Health Facility and Health Service Access Dashboards
    • • Addition of indicators from the Joint Annual Report (JAR) 2024 to MSDAT
    • • Addition NTDs data to Health Outcomes and Demographics
    • • Inclusion of additional Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) data on MSDAT
    • • Health Finance Dashboard update with the latest National Health Account (NHA) data
    • • What's New page


    Thank you for being part of the MSDAT community! We value your feedback and are excited to continue providing you with accurate and insightful health data analytics.



    For suggestions, inquiries, or comments, email us at msdat@e4email.net

    Visit MSDAT Now

    THANKS FOR READING

    Best regards,
    MSDAT Team at The Department of Health Planning, Research & Statistics Federal Ministry of Health

Copyright (C) 2025 Federal Ministry of Health, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
Department of Health Planning Research and Statistics (DHPRS)
New Federal Secretariat Complex, Phase III,
Ahmadu Bello Way, Central Business District,
FCT Abuja, Nigeria

Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe

input.body:
The Multi-Source Data Analytics and
Triangulation (MSDAT) Platform Update

Saving lives through digital health data

Hi {{step_29['item']['full_name']}},

I trust this meets you well.

You got this mail because you have either interacted with the MSDAT platform or the team behind it. We are excited to introduce the new MSDAT 2.6 Version

This MSDAT platform was set up by the Federal Ministry of Health (FMoH) through a collaboration with eHealth4everyone. It provides a single, transparent view of key health indicators from multiple data sources.

What this means is that you have access to different perspectives of any health indicator all in one place. By "different perspectives," we mean results from various trusted health-related data collection activities that aid decision-making processes in the country.

The platform also allows the comparison of key metrics across three categories of data sources, namely; routine, surveys, and global estimates.

Dashboards Update

{{trigger['body']['data'][0]['value']}} Click here.


{{trigger['body']['data'][3]['value']}}

Data Update

{{trigger['body']['data'][4]['value']}}


Onboarding

The onboarding feature introduces you to the MSDAT and the sections of the platform. It also provides a link to a video tutorial that gives a detailed explanation of each section of the MSDAT

Watch Now
Tour guide

The tour guide is very interactive; it shows the basic functions and where to locate them on the platform. It usually follows after the onboarding process. However, this tour guide can be accessed at the right top corner of the page as seen below.



Feedback button

We love this feature, it helps us get specific feedback from users like you. The feature presents the opportunity to capture segments of the platform where you want to provide feedback. Knowing how technology can be unpredictable, it is possible users will experience unique anomalies and we would want to be able to prevent their re-occurrence. This feedback button is our mutual friend.

Give Feedback

In subsequent editions of this newsletter, we would discuss more features and also inform you about new developments as they are implemented on the platform. We would love to get your feedback and suggestions. If you have any questions, suggestions or comments regarding the platform; or you would like to suggest the kind of content you want to see in these newsletters, kindly send an email to msdat@e4email.net


You got this mail because you either have interacted with the MSDAT platform or our team at a point in time.

THANKS FOR READING

Best regards,
from the Department of Health Planning, Research and Statistics
for the Federal Ministry of Health

Copyright (C) 2025 Federal Ministry of Health, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
Department of Health Planning Research and Statistics (DHPRS)
New Federal Secretariat Complex, Phase III,
Ahmadu Bello Way, Central Business District,
FCT Abuja, Nigeria

You can update your preferences or unsubscribe
